intro: Dortmanna ensiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Dortmanna, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Dortmanna ensiformis is primarily found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
